docs.snippet: Each week through June 4, the top-notch men’s e-tailer  Mr Porter  will unveil an exclusive capsule collection, drawing both from cult labels and established designers like  Raf Simons . The first one, on sale May 14, comes from the Tokyo b...
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week through June 4, the top-notch men’s e-tailer Mr Porter will unveil an exclusive capsule collection, drawing both from cult labels and established designers like Raf Simons . The first one, on sale May 14, comes from the Tokyo brand Beams Plus , and fuses two classic American looks that the Japanese have long fetishized — surf and Ivy League style — with comic results: khaki board shorts, anyone? Forthcoming collections include Alexander Wang’s sophisticated update of jock staples (like collared baseball tees) and elegant sportswear from Ami inspired by the “bobos” who hang around the Canal Saint-Martin in Paris.

docs.snippet: CARCONE--Fred. Creator Of Video Arcades. Fred Carcone came to this country from Italy in 1927, alone at seven years old from Italy to join his two sisters and father in Queens, New York. He was intelligent strong, willful, and adventurous. He died...
docs.lead_paragraph: CARCONE--Fred. Creator Of Video Arcades. Fred Carcone came to this country from Italy in 1927, alone at seven years old from Italy to join his two sisters and father in Queens, New York. He was intelligent strong, willful, and adventurous. He died Saturday April 21, 2013 peacefully at 93. His education was minimal, only completing the sixth grade, at which time he worked with his father in the grocery business helping to support the family which was his enduring emotional support. He learned early that this was to him the most important part of his being because he had a nurturing way and enjoyed giving to others, especially family which was the most endearing to him. This set the path for all of his life. The natural creative genius, God given, empowered him to find new and unusual approaches to business. Both his brother- in-law, John Christofpher and Ale Simon, admiring his character, helped him to find his niche on Broadway. His ethics and focus turned around three failing businesses of which he was involved. He become the proprietor of two arcades on Broadway, New York, and one arcade of which he owned the building, in Newark, New Jersey. His achievements in life were profound and amazing. He worked in an area that allowed him to express his originality for five decades and always remembered his humble beginnings saying, "I can only wear one pair of pants, a shirt and a pair of shoes, no matter how much money I have". Compassion for friends and family, and helping them achieve their dreams was foremost on his mind. He wanted others to be given opportunities to achieve their dreams. Baseball and The New York Yankees was his second passion. His endearing, quite natured, soft-spoken manner and magnanimous smile will be sorely missed. He has joined his Shepherd and is now where he belongs, in heaven.

Herbert Blau, a fiercely iconoclastic theater director, scholar and theorist who staged some of the earliest productions of Beckett, Brecht and Genet in the United States, died in Seattle on May 3, his 87th birthday.
   
The cause was a sa...
docs.lead_paragraph:
Herbert Blau, a fiercely iconoclastic theater director, scholar and theorist who staged some of the earliest productions of Beckett, Brecht and Genet in the United States, died in Seattle on May 3, his 87th birthday.
 
The cause was a sarcomatoid carcinoma of the chest, a type of cancer, his family said.

headline.main: Herbert Blau, Pioneering Theater Director, Dies at 87

docs.snippet: Iran’s presidential campaign took an unexpected turn on Saturday, when two game-changing politicians entered the race in the final minutes of a five-day registration period....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iran’s presidential campaign took an unexpected turn on Saturday, when two game-changing politicians entered the race in the final minutes of a five-day registration period.
docs.abstract: Former Iranian Pres Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, who was soundly defeated by Pres Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in 2005 election, and Esfandiar Rahim Mashaei, protege of Ahmadinejad, register at last minute as presidential candidates; both are out of favor with country's leaders and candidacies could shake up presidential race.

headline.main: Two Candidates Shake Up Iran’s Presidential Race as Last-Minute Entries
headline.print_headline: Two Candidates Shake Up Iran’s Presidential Race as Last-Minute Entries
